BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Synopsis: Kenton's stuck in the mud.

BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Prayer For The Day with the Reverend Elfed ap Nefydd Roberts.

BasicDescription.Title: Farming Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agricultural news and features with Miriam O'Reilly

BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Sarah Montague and James Naughtie. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: Melvyn Bragg: In Our Time
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Melvyn Bragg and guests discuss the history of ideas.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jenni Murray. Includes, at 10.45am [rptd today 7.45pm] the drama, Live Alone And Like It, by Marjorie Hillis. Judith and Sylvia haven't seen Marjorie for a whole week. They're worried.

With Jenni Murray. Includes, at 10.45am the drama:
Live Alone And Like It
By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
Judith and Sylvia haven't seen Marjorie for a whole week. Whatever can be the matter? Better go round and find out. But at 9 o'clock in the morning?
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: Crossing Continents
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Namibia: Is President Sam Nujoma taking his country down the same road as Zimbabwe? Rosie Goldsmith travels around this vast country in search of the answer to that question.

Namibia
When Sam Nujoma, President of Namibia, shook his finger and railed at Tony Blair at the Earth summit in September the world took notice. Calling Blair a colonialist and blaming the British for the ills of Southern Africa he staunchly defended his friend Robert Mugabe's right to deal with white farmers as he saw fit and declared that Namibia doesn't need western aid.
Is Nujoma taking his country down the same road as Zimbabwe? Rosie Goldsmith travels around this vast country in search of the answer to that question.

BasicDescription.Title: Hey-Nonny-Nonny And Fa-La-La
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lucie Skeaping looks at the sexual content of songs in Ancient Rome, Islamic and Orthodox Jewish traditions and Music Hall. Hey Nonny-Nonny and Fa-La-La were common euphemisms in English madrigals.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with Liz Barclay and Winifred Robinson.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: Open Country
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Helen Mark uncovers more stories and characters from the British countryside. .

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Poor Echo: By Matthew Dunster. A drama exploring fantasy, storytelling and the need to talk. Three women overhear a story in the hairdresser's and react in very different ways.

Poor Echo
By Matthew Dunster
One story, three short plays, a whole new drama exploring fantasy, storytelling and the need to talk. Three women overhear the same story in the hairdresser's and react in very different ways.
Joanne/Sarah ...... Emma Atkins Rob ...... Colum Convey Sue ...... Brigit Forsyth Marsha ...... Katy Cavanagh Louisa/Liz/Tina ...... Helen Moon Dr. John/Russell ...... Glenn Cunningham
Directed by Pauline Harris

BasicDescription.Title: Taking Issue
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A columnist advances a controversial view on a subject, then listeners can take issue by calling 08700 100 444 [national rates apply]. With David Jessel. Then Radio 4 Appeal.

BasicDescription.Title: Love And Loss
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The White Peacock Of Holland Park: By Hanan-al-Shaykh. Lonely in London, Yasmin imports her fantasies from the Lebanon. Part of a series of five stories about the bitterness of love.

BasicDescription.Title: Blood Chronicles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Blood Prejudice: Prejudice has often been expressed in terms of blood. Graeme Garden examines blood prejudice and explores how the concept of blood purity has destroyed so many lives.

BasicDescription.Title: Bookclub
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Bookclub is off to Beaufort Polo Club with James Naughtie to meet writer Jilly Cooper and a group of readers, to talk about her racy novel, Polo.

BasicDescription.Title: The Material World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Quentin Cooper speaks to Dr Bradley Edwards of HighLift systems who is trying to develop a lift for tourists going into space - an idea that could be realised in as little as 15 years time.

Holiday destinations for the year 2020 Malaga, Florida, the Moon, Mars, Venus, Asteroid Belt.... Science Fiction could become Science fact with the development of an lift straight into space.
Quentin Cooper will be speaking to Dr Bradley Edwards of HighLift systems who is trying to develop the space lift and to Dr David Raitt from the European Space Agency. This revolutionary way of getting from earth to space could become a reality in as little as 15 years time!

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Eddie Mair and Carolyn Quinn.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Think The Unthinkable
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Comedy series by James Cary about a team of management consultants who transform companies in ways they barely understand themselves. Stars Marcus Brigstocke.

Don't miss this Sony Award winning sitcom about management consultants. Join the team as they transform companies in ways they barely understand.
Stars Marcus Brigstocke, Catherine Shepherd, Emma Kennedy and David Mitchell.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The big switch on.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Francine Stock with the arts and entertainment show.

BasicDescription.Title: Live Alone And Like It
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler. Judith and Sylvia haven't seen Marjorie for a whole week. Whatever can be the matter?

By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
Judith and Sylvia haven't seen Marjorie for a whole week. Whatever can be the matter? Better go round and find out. But at 9 o'clock in the morning?
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: Gorazde: The Peacekeeper's Tale
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Gorazde : The Peacekeeper's Tale. Corporal Dave Vaatstra tells how men from his battalion, the Royal Welsh Fusiliers, fought to save Gorazde from an attacking Serbian army in 1995.

Gorazde : The Peacekeeper's Tale
Seven years ago, British Army Corporal Dave Vaatstra and his fellow soldiers were sent as UN Peacekeepers to the war in Bosnia to the so-called "Safe Area" of Gorazde, a sister town to Srebrenica.
In May 1995, the Serbs attacked Gorazde in an assault never made public at the time, snatching 33 British hostages and threatening to take the town itself. It was a national crisis and came as widespread hostage-taking in Bosnia brought the whole UN mission to collapse.
Corporal Vaatstra tells how men from his battalion, the Royal Welsh Fusiliers, fought to save the town. Reported and compiled by Gillian Sandford, this is a tale from the trenches told by the men who were there.

BasicDescription.Title: Analysis
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The European Juggernaut: Ideas for a European constitution will allow countries to leave the EU. Bruce Clark asks whether a Union that was losing members would survive.

The European Juggernaut
Soon the European Union will stretch from Galway to the Black Sea and have huge powers over 400 million people. But ideas for a European constitution include plans for countries to leave the EU, voluntarily or after being expelled.
Bruce Clark asks whether a Union that was losing members as well as gaining them could survive, and whether the European juggernaut can stay on the road.

BasicDescription.Title: Leading Edge
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Geoff Watts meets a Zoologist who keeps a very close eye on wild animals with the help of a high-tech radio collar which eavesdrops on intricate details of their experience.

Geoff Watts meets a Zoologist who keeps a very close eye on wild animals. With the help of Zebranet, a high-tech radio collar, he tracks not only the encounters of the wearer but also eavesdrops on the comings and goings of its neighbours, shedding light on the social networking of entire groups.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: What Became Of Geoffrey: By Margery Allingham. Anton Lessor continues one of Allingham's best loved stories of post war crime in the foggy streets of London.

BasicDescription.Title: A Set And A Song
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A Set And A Song: If you were tempted to have a one night stand and knew you could get away with it would you? A few minutes with master story teller Smug Roberts and musician Martin Coogan.

BasicDescription.Title: Something Or Other
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A series that should appeal to the downtrodden. Alex, a teacher in his 40s, is longing for change. Will Grant help him or not? Written and performed by Grant Cathro and Alex Bartlette.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A review of the day's events in Parliament.
